title: OpenAI to Launch Proprietary AI Chip with Broadcom
full: OpenAI is set to begin mass production of its own AI chips in 2026, co-designed with Broadcom. These chips will be used exclusively within OpenAI to enhance performance and reduce dependency on Nvidia.

title: Anthropic Settles $1.5B Copyright Lawsuit
full: Anthropic has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to authors in a landmark lawsuit over pirated books, marking the largest AI-copyright settlement to date.

title: Switzerland Releases 100% Open AI Model
full: Switzerland has launched a fully open-source AI model, promoting transparency and accessibility in AI development.

title: Apple Faces Lawsuit Over AI Training Data
full: Authors have sued Apple for using their books without permission to train AI models, raising concerns over intellectual property rights.

title: AWS to Feature Generative AI at IBC2025
full: Amazon Web Services will showcase generative AI innovations at IBC2025, focusing on media and entertainment applications.

title: IBM Unveils Emotionally Attuned AI Commentary
full: IBM has introduced AI-driven tennis commentary that adjusts tone and enthusiasm based on match dynamics, enhancing fan engagement.

title: Alibaba's AI Cloud Business Drives Stock Surge
full: Alibaba's AI-powered cloud services have led to a 19% surge in its stock price, reflecting strong investor confidence.

title: Microsoft Offers Free AI Tools to U.S. Government
full: Microsoft has partnered with the U.S. government to provide free access to AI tools, aiming to modernize federal operations.

title: UK AI Sector Hits Record £2.9B Investment
full: The UK's AI sector has attracted a record £2.9 billion in investment, solidifying its position as a global AI hub.

title: ARN Explores Replacing Human Hosts with AI
full: Australian radio network ARN is testing AI-generated voices to replace human presenters, aiming to reduce costs.
